item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | The US may still force Russia into a bond default in the coming weeks, debt strategist says
item.description: "The Americans still have the leverage," BlueBay strategist Timothy Ash said. "They can force Russia to default any time."

item.title: News24.com | Putin apologised for Russia Hitler claims: Israel PM's office
item.description: Israel's Prime Minister Naftali Bennett said Thursday that Russian leader Vladimir Putin has apologised for remarks made by Moscow's top diplomat, Sergei Lavrov, who claimed Adolf Hitler may have had "Jewish blood".

item.title: News24.com | Death toll rises to 26 in Chinese building collapse
item.description: Chinese authorities have raised the number of people confirmed dead in a building collapse to 26, nearly a week after the block containing apartments, a hotel and a cinema caved in.

item.title: News24.com | Dozens killed in Haiti in 2 weeks of gun battles, thousands flee homes
item.description: Gun battles between rival gangs in Port-au-Prince have killed dozens in the past two weeks and forced thousands to flee their homes, Haiti's civil protection authority and a UN agency said.

item.title: News24.com | Covid pandemic killed 13 to 17 million in 2020-21: WHO
item.description: The Covid-19 pandemic killed 13.3 to 16.6 million people in 2020 and 2021, the WHO estimated Thursday - up to triple the number of deaths officially attributed to the disease.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | WHO estimates nearly 15m people died from Covid-19 in the first two years of the pandemic
item.description: The new estimate is around 2.7 times higher than the 5.4 million deaths reported by governments to the WHO during the same time period.

item.title: News24.com | WATCH | War in Ukraine: watch all the latest videos as the conflict escalates
News24.com | EU citizens may sue countries for health-damaging dirty air, top court adviser says
item.description: Citizens in European Union countries may be able to sue their governments for financial compensation if illegal levels of air pollution damage their health, an adviser to Europe's top court said.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Elon Musk will likely appoint himself temporary Twitter CEO, CNBC reports
item.description: Sources told CNBC's David Faber the appointment would last "a few months" following the close of the $44 billion acquisition deal.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Elon Musk said he secured another $7bn backing for his Twitter deal — including from a Saudi prince
item.description: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance is pledging $500 million for Elon Musk's proposed $44 billion acquisition of Twitter.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | WATCH | Capitol Hill veteran in Ukraine shuttling refugees and relief aid all over war-torn country
item.description: Relying on phone apps and text messaging, Steven Moore says he's helped more than 100 Ukrainians escape the war since he packed up and flew there shortly after Putin launched his attacks.

item.title: News24.com | The inmate and the officer: Alabama's improbable prison escape
item.description: A guard with a spotless record and a convict accused of murder - this unlikely pair has vexed US law enforcement for days as they investigate an Alabama prison break seemingly planned down to the last detail.

item.title: News24.com | Indian police arrest officer accused of raping assault victim
item.description: Indian police have arrested an officer accused of raping a 13-year-old girl in the northern state of Uttar Pradesh after she went to him to report her gang rape, an incident that sparked outrage in a country notorious for assaults on women.

item.title: News24.com | Russian ceasefire to begin at besieged Mariupol steel plant
item.description: A Russian-announced ceasefire was due to begin on Thursday at the besieged steel plant in the devastated Ukrainian city of Mariupol, to allow civilians to flee even as its defenders vowed to fight to the end.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Many South Koreans are still wearing their masks even after the law mandating them was lifted
item.description: "To suddenly pull off a mask in a pandemic and then potentially spread an infection would be a potential loss-of-face situation," said one expert.

item.title: News24.com | As scandals overshadow vote, UK PM Johnson faces election test
item.description: Voters in Britain will go to the polls in local government elections on Thursday where they are expected to punish Prime Minister Boris Johnson over a cost-of-living crisis and fines for breaking his own Covid-19 lockdown rules.

item.title: News24.com | Amber Heard chokes back tears while testifying in trial against Johnny Depp
item.description: Amber Heard testified on Wednesday that her ex-husband, Johnny Depp, was obsessively jealous and would punch walls and slap and hit her in drunken rages.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Twitter fails to calm jittery advertisers over Musk plans at rushed sales showcase
item.description: At the annual IAB NewFronts, Twitter executives maintained it was business as usual at the company.

item.title: News24.com | Maradona's 'hand of God' World Cup jersey sells for R144 million at auction
item.description: The jersey that Argentina football legend Diego Maradona wore while scoring twice against England in the 1986 World Cup, including the infamous "hand of God" goal, was auctioned for $9.3 million.

item.title: News24.com | Colombia extradites drug lord 'Otoniel' to US
item.description: One of Colombia's most notorious drug lords was extradited on Wednesday to the United States to face drug trafficking charges, announced President Ivan Duque.
